name: Althea
description:
As I was going down impassive Rivers,
I no longer felt myself guided by haulers:

name: Theseus
description:
Yelping redskins had taken them as targets
And had nailed them naked to colored stakes.

name: Persephone
description:
I was indifferent to all crews,
The bearer of Flemish wheat or English cottons

name: Delphi
description:
When with my haulers this uproar stopped
The Rivers let me go where I wanted.

name: Leanos
description:
Into the furious lashing of the tides
More heedless than children's brains the other winter

name: Icarus
description:
I ran! And loosened Peninsulas
Have not undergone a more triumphant hubbub

name: Eugenio
description:
The storm blessed my sea vigils
Lighter than a cork I danced on the waves

name: Cassius
description:
That are called eternal rollers of victims,
Ten nights, without missing the stupid eye of the lighthouses!

name: Archimedes
description:
Sweeter than the flesh of hard apples is to children
The green water penetrated my hull of fir

name: Theodoros
description:
And washed me of spots of blue wine
And vomit, scattering rudder and grappling-hook

name: Maximus
description:
And from then on I bathed in the Poem
Of the Sea, infused with stars and lactescent,
